# Introduction

# `salmer`

```{r}
df <- hymns %>% 
  mutate(author = author %>% 
           fct_infreq() %>% 
           fct_lump_n(n = 1) %>% 
           fct_explicit_na(na_level = "Other"))
```

```{r}
stopda <- tibble(word = stopwords::stopwords(language = "da"))

toks <- df %>% 
  unnest_tokens(word, text) %>% 
  count(author, word, sort = TRUE) %>% 
  #anti_join(stopda) %>% 
  bind_log_odds(author, word, n, unweighted = T) %>% 
  mutate(sum_n = sum(n)) %>% 
  group_by(author) %>% 
  mutate(sum_author = sum(n)) %>% 
  group_by(word) %>% 
  mutate(sum_word = sum(n)) %>% 
  ungroup() %>% 
  mutate(p = (n+1)/(sum_author+1),
         odds = p/(1-p),
         log_odds3 = log(odds),
         log_odds2 = log(((n + 1) / (sum_author + 1)) / 
    ((sum_word - n + 1) / (sum_n - sum_author +1))
    )
  )
```

```{r}
toks %>%
    group_by(author) %>%
    top_n(10, log_odds_weighted) %>%
    ungroup %>%
    mutate(word = fct_reorder(word, log_odds_weighted)) %>%
    ggplot(aes(word, log_odds_weighted, fill = author)) +
    geom_col(show.legend = FALSE) +
    facet_wrap(~ author, scales = "free_y") +
    coord_flip() +
    scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0,0)) +
    labs(y = "Log odds ratio, weighted by uninformative Dirichlet prior",
         x = NULL,
         title = "What are the most characteristic words for each writer?")
```
